item.title: Kevin Hart's New Online Comedy Service Joins Crowded Streaming Market
item.description: August 1, 2017 - Kevin Hart is launching a streaming comedy service. The actor's Laugh Out Loud Network, which rolls out this week, enters an already crowded market. LANGUAGE ADVISORY: There are two bleeps in actualities in this piece at :14 and :44 in.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: August 1, 2017 - Kevin Hart is launching a streaming comedy service. The actor's Laugh Out Loud Network, which rolls out this week, enters an already crowded market. LANGUAGE ADVISORY: There are two bleeps in actualities in this piece at :14 and :44 in. http://www.npr.org/2017/08/01/540755174/kevin-harts-new-online-comedy-service-joins-crowded-streaming-market

item.title: Tech Incubator Faces Challenges Of Tackling Sexual Harassment Among Investors
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Y Combinator, an influential startup incubator, sends its entrepreneurs a form to report sexual harassment. Such reports influence which venture capitalists get invited to its prestigious Demo Day.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Y Combinator, an influential startup incubator, sends its entrepreneurs a form to report sexual harassment. Such reports influence which venture capitalists get invited to its prestigious Demo Day. http://www.npr.org/sections/alltechconsidered/2017/07/31/540578895/tech-incubator-faces-challenges-of-tackling-sexual-harassment-among-investors

item.title: Watchdog Group Files Complaint Over Google Tracking In-Person Purchases
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Using search and app data, combined with third-party credit card records, Google can link online ad viewing to purchases at physical stores. User privacy may be at risk, an advocacy group says.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Using search and app data, combined with third-party credit card records, Google can link online ad viewing to purchases at physical stores. User privacy may be at risk, an advocacy group says. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/540610933/watchdog-group-files-complaint-over-google-tracking-in-person-purchases

item.title: Familiar-Looking Numbers Are The Latest Twist In Robocalls
item.description: July 31, 2017 - Ailsa Chang looks at a now rampant kind of robocalling — neighbor spoofing. These are automated calls coming from phone numbers that look strangely similar to the recipient's own phone numbers.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - Ailsa Chang looks at a now rampant kind of robocalling — neighbor spoofing. These are automated calls coming from phone numbers that look strangely similar to the recipient's own phone numbers. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/540515367/familiar-looking-numbers-are-the-latest-twist-in-robocalls

item.title: Timeline: Foreign Efforts To Hack State Election Systems And How Officials Responded
item.description: July 31, 2017 - For all the focus in 2016 on the cyberattacks against the Democratic National Committee and Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta, less attention was paid to what was happening in the states.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - For all the focus in 2016 on the cyberattacks against the Democratic National Committee and Clinton campaign chairman John Podesta, less attention was paid to what was happening in the states. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/31/539483156/timeline-foreign-efforts-to-hack-state-election-systems-and-how-officials-respon

item.title: How Steve Jobs Helped This North Korean Defector 'Think Different'
item.description: July 31, 2017 - When Kim Hak-min got to South Korea, he saw his first-ever smartphone, the iPhone 4. It changed his life trajectory.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 31, 2017 - When Kim Hak-min got to South Korea, he saw his first-ever smartphone, the iPhone 4. It changed his life trajectory. http://www.npr.org/sections/parallels/2017/07/31/540226659/how-steve-jobs-helped-this-north-korean-defector-think-different

item.title: This Wisconsin 'Chip Party' Doesn't Come With Cheese Dip
item.description: July 30, 2017 - Some employees of 32M have volunteered to have microchips implanted in them. NPR's Noel King and University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee professor of information studies Michael Zimmer, explore the risks.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 30, 2017 - Some employees of 32M have volunteered to have microchips implanted in them. NPR's Noel King and University of Wisconsin-Milwaukee professor of information studies Michael Zimmer, explore the risks. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/30/540448094/this-wisconsin-chip-party-doesnt-come-with-cheese-dip

item.title: For Maine Islands, Internet Means Opportunity
item.description: July 30, 2017 - Residents of some Maine islands say lack of decent internet is keeping them from participating in the economy. Jobs are in short supply and telecommuting isn't practical.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 30, 2017 - Residents of some Maine islands say lack of decent internet is keeping them from participating in the economy. Jobs are in short supply and telecommuting isn't practical. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/30/540359398/for-maine-islands-internet-means-opportunity

item.title: Apple Accused Of Removing Apps Used To Evade Censorship From Its China Store
item.description: July 29, 2017 - VPNs can be used to skirt China's "Great Firewall" of Internet censorship. China is among Apple's biggest markets, and the company has shown a willingness to comply with Beijing's demands.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 29, 2017 - VPNs can be used to skirt China's "Great Firewall" of Internet censorship. China is among Apple's biggest markets, and the company has shown a willingness to comply with Beijing's demands. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/29/540280448/apple-accused-of-removing-apps-used-to-evade-censorship-from-its-china-store

item.title: British Hacker Known As 'Spiderman' Sentenced Over Cyberattack
item.description: July 28, 2017 - The 29-year-old man was given a suspended sentence of one year and eight months in an attack that reportedly knocked out Internet for nearly 1 million people in Germany in November.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 28, 2017 - The 29-year-old man was given a suspended sentence of one year and eight months in an attack that reportedly knocked out Internet for nearly 1 million people in Germany in November. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/07/28/540022288/british-hacker-known-as-spiderman-sentenced-over-cyberattack

item.title: What If You Booked A Ride — And There Was A Matchmaker In The Backseat?
item.description:
July 27, 2017 - Pakistan's popular Careem app ran the campaign. The company thought it was funny. But a lot of women hated it.
- http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/07/27/539560271/pakistani-ride-sharing-app-puts-a-matchmaker-in-the-car
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)

item.title: Social Media Lets Anti-Government Bundys Reach Followers
item.description: July 27, 2017 - Groups who monitor far-right extremists warn that anti-government militants are increasingly using social media to promote armed protests and violence.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - Groups who monitor far-right extremists warn that anti-government militants are increasingly using social media to promote armed protests and violence. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539682677/social-media-lets-anti-government-bundys-reach-followers

item.title: Rep. Keith Ellison On Trump And The Media
item.description: July 27, 2017 - Minnesota Rep. Keith Ellison tells Rachel Martin that he thinks Twitter should ban President Trump after the president tweeted insults to members of the media.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - Minnesota Rep. Keith Ellison tells Rachel Martin that he thinks Twitter should ban President Trump after the president tweeted insults to members of the media. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539682647/rep-keith-ellison-on-trump-and-the-media

item.title: Morning News Brief: Health Care, Transgender Service Members, Foxconn, Charlie Gard
item.description: July 27, 2017 - Republicans continue debating health care plans while President Trump tweeted about transgender people in the military. Tony Romm of Recode discusses electronics-maker Foxconn's U.S. factory plans.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 27, 2017 - Republicans continue debating health care plans while President Trump tweeted about transgender people in the military. Tony Romm of Recode discusses electronics-maker Foxconn's U.S. factory plans. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/27/539682616/morning-news-brief-health-care-transgender-service-members-foxconn-charlie-gard

item.title: How New York's Roosevelt Island Sucks Away Summer Trash Stink
item.description: July 26, 2017 - Underneath high-rise apartment buildings along the 2-mile island, an automated trash disposal system whisks away nearly 6 tons of trash per day through pipes and tubes.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: July 26, 2017 - Underneath high-rise apartment buildings along the 2-mile island, an automated trash disposal system whisks away nearly 6 tons of trash per day through pipes and tubes. http://www.npr.org/2017/07/26/539304811/how-new-york-s-roosevelt-island-sucks-away-summer-trash-stink
